0.user_question: Walter is collecting money for charity. First he collects $500 from his neighbors. Then he collects $2971849 from a fund he set up online. His lawyer offers to donate three times as much as everyone else donates. Walter is going to tell him about his neighbors and the online fund until his friend gives him $200 as well. How much is Walter's lawyer going to contribute?

ost_step.1: Total amount collected before adding friend's contribution = $500 (from neighbors) + $2971849 (online).

direct_answer.text: First we need to calculate the total sum contributed so far which equals: $500 + $2971849 = $2972349. Accordingly, if Walter tells this information to his attorney who pledges to triple any other contributions made thus far it would equal: $2972349*3= $8917047. Finally when you add your own part ($200), everything totals up to: $8917047+ $200=$8917247. Thus, the lawyer’s contribution according to their agreement comes out to be $8917047. However since I am not asked what was actually received but rather how much Walter promised based upon previous sums contributes, my last digit remains unchanged because no further action needs taken beyond telling the story unto himself or others henceforth; therefore our resultant figure stays intact without change being applied into its digits thereby making $$$8917047$$ correct regardless while still adhering strictly within constraints laid down previously!
